answers.answer: Hi,Would you be able to describe the pain? Burning,tingling,stabbing, sharp, shooting?Is this associated with any position (like bending) ,any activity, stress, weather changes?Any numbness in other parts of the body?Have you tried taking any medications to relieve the pain?Have you injured your neck lately?Any change in diet and sleep patterns? Headaches and faintness may be due to lack of sleep or skipping meals.Try taking analgesics and see if the pain subsides.If the pain persists then you may want to consult your physician for a complete work up.Try to relax.Exercise daily and eat well.Good Luck!

I have had numbness in my hands. I am a migraine suffer.I do take migraine medication with not much results.No neck or head injuries. I do take lunesta for sleep but because of mail order Pharmacy I have been out of it for two weeks.The pain is a sharp shooting pain that starts in the back side of my head and progresses down to my arm and then my leg.Position does not change this.

Hi,A sharp and shooting pain that seems to radiate to a certain part of your body may be nerve related.Is this pain similar to what you have experienced before?The pain of migraine is usually unilateral ,throbbing and may be associated with some neurologic symptoms like seeing spots of light (migraine aura).It is usually aggravated by loud noises or bright lights.Do you have any of these?What you may be having is  neuralgia or neuropathic pain ( nerve related pain) that may be caused by infections ( herpes zoster), alcoholism, diabetes,trauma and certain medications.Are you a chronic alcohol drinker?How is your blood sugar level?A disk compression in the cervical spine may also cause a similar type of pain affecting the area that the nerve innervates.Neuropathic pain may be associated with a tingling and burning sensation.I suggest you consult with your neurologist so that your pain may be classified.A regular analgesic may not be able to help if this is nerve related pain.Further evaluation may be necessary to rule out involvement of the cervical spine as well as other underlying conditions like diabetes and nutritional disorders.I hope this helps.Keep in touch with us regarding your progress.

question: I have had this odd feeling in my head for past two days. It's a sharp pain that is on the right side lower part of head near my neck and then the sharp pain is felt in my arm and then in my calf. This pain happens intermitently through out the day. I also feel weak and look pale. Anyone know what this could be. Thanks
title: odd headache
